titleStmt.title: Gädlä Qirqos “Vita of Cyricus” / Täʾamrä Qirqos “Miracles of Cyricus” / Mälkǝʾa Qirqos “Image of Cyricus” / Sälam-hymn for Cyricus

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

msItem.title: I. Gädlä Qirqos “Vita of Cyricus”
msItem.incipit: Fol. 2ra: በስመ፡ʼʼ… ንዌጥን፡ በረድኤተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ልዑል፨ ጽሒፈ፡ ገድሉ፡ ወስምዑ፡ ለብፅዕ፡ ወቅዱስ፡ ማር፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፨ አንጌቤናይ፡ ወዜና፡ እሙ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ ወዘካልአንሂ፡ ፻፻ወ፲፻ወ፬፻፵ወ፰፡ እለ፡ ተከለሉ፡ ምስሌሁ፡ በመዋዕለ፡ እስክንድሮስ፡ መኰንን፡ ጸሎቶሙ፡ ወበረከቶሙ፡ የሃሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁሮሙ፡ ሀብተ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ወምስለ፡ ፍቅርቶሙ፡ [vac] …Fol. 2ra: In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. We commence, with the help of the Lord, the Most High, the writing of the life and the martyrdom of the blessed and saint Mar Cyricus, martyr, noble, and of his mother Julitta and of other 11,438 martyrs who were crowned together with him during the time of the governor Alexander. May their prayer and blessing be with their beloved Habtä Śǝllase and with their beloved …
msItem.explicit: Fol. 24va, l.2: … ወናሁ፡ ማር፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሀለወ፡ ወትረ፡ እንዘ፡ ይቀውም፡ ብየማነ፡ እግዚአብሔር፨ ወይተነብል፡ ምሕረተ፡ በእንቲአነ፨ ወናሁ፡ በዝየ፡ ተፈጸመ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ገድሉ፡ ለሕፃን፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ አምላካዊ፨ በረከቱ፡ ጸሎቱ፡ የሃሎ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቅሩ፡ ሀብተ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ወምስለ፡ ፍቅርቱ፡ [vac] ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ ፨ ፨Fol. 24va, l.2: … and now Mar Cyricus exists always standing on the right of the Lord. And he intercedes (to receive) mercy for our sake. And now, here, the book of the life of the infant Cyricus, martyr, divine, is completed. May his blessing and his prayer be with his beloved Habtä Śǝllase and her beloved … Forever and ever. Amen.

msItem.title: II. Täʾamrä Qirqos “Miracles of Cyricus” (3 miracles)
msItem.incipit: Fol. 24vb: (Introduction) በስመ፡ʼʼ… ነዋ፡ ጸሐፍነ፡ ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፨ ንስቲተ፡ አምብዙኀ፡ ዝንጋዔ፨ ከመ፡ ይኩን፡ ለሰማዕያን፡ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ የሃሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ገብሩ፡ ሀብተ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ወምስለ፡ አመቱ፡ [vac] ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፨ (Miracle 1) ወሀሎ፡ ፩ንጉሥ፡ ጸድቅ፡ ወካህን፡ ዘተወክፈ፡ ሢመተ፡ ክህነት፡ እምአምላኩ፡ በሀገረ፡ ሮሀ፡ ቅዱስት፡ … Fol. 24vb: (Introduction) In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. Now, let us write the miracles of saint Cyricus, martyr. A little from a lot of the insanity, so that it might be for the listeners (?). May his prayer and his blessing be with his servant Habtä Śǝllase, and with his maid … Forever. (Miracle 1) And there was a righteous king-priest who received the investiture of a priest from his God in the holy city “Roha”. …
msItem.explicit: Fol. 28ra, l.7: ... ለዛቲ፡ ተአምር፡ ዘአጽሐፉ፡ ሀብተ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ኃጥእ፡ ወጊጉይ፡ ገብሩ፡ ለሕያወ፡ ባሕርይ፡ አዶናይ፨ በእንተ፡ ፍቅሩ፡ ለሰማዕት፡ ቂርቆስ፡ አንጌቤናይ፨ ከመ፡ ይስአል፡ ሎቱ፡ ዓስበ፡ በመንግሥተ፡ ሰማይ፨ እምኀበ፡ አምላኩ፡ ፀሐይ፨ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ ወአሜን፨ ፨ ፨ ፨Fol. 28ra, l.7: ... For this (book of) Miracles which Habtä Śǝllase, sinful and guilty servant of the living of the pearl, Adonai, caused it to be written, about the beloved martyr Cyricus, noble, so that he might pray to him (to receive) the recompense in the Kingdom of Heaven, from his God, the Sun. Forever and ever. Amen, and Amen.

listBibl.bibl: EMML no. 303 (20th cent., Church of St. Raphael, quarter of Guläle, ʾAddis ʾAbäba),
EMML no. 615 (1966, Church of Qirqos, quarter of Boleʾ, ʾAddis ʾAbäba),
EMML no. 3469 (19th cent., Church of Šäwa Meda Qirqos, Gubbalafto, Yäğğu, Wällo),
EMML no. 4816 (1951/2, Church of Däse Mädḫane ˤAläm, Wällo),

note.p: II-1) Fols. 24vb (l.12) – 26ra (l.10): The righteous king-priest from the holy city of “Roha”.
II-2) Fols. 26ra (l.11) – 26vb (l.15): St. Cyricus and the barren couple who was supplicating to the saint to have a child.
II-3) Fols. 26vb (l.16) – 28ra: St. Cyricus and monk ʾElyas.

msItem.title: III. Mälkǝʾa Qirqos “Image of Cyricus” (47 strophes)
msItem.incipit: Fol. 28rb: ኦክርስቶስ፡ ናዝራዊ፡ ዘተወከፍከ፡ ሕማመ፡ ፀሐይ፡ ብሩህ፡ ወጽዱል፡ አመ፡ ሱረሔሁ፡ አጽለመ፨ መጽሐፈ፡ ዜናሁ፡ ለቂርቆስ፡ መንፈሳዊ፡ ወዘመልክዑ፡ ሰላመ፨ ጸሐፍ፡ ውስተ፡ ውብየ[sic]፡ እንዘ፡ ትገብር፡ ቀለመ፨ ደመከ፡ አምላካዌ፡ በመስቀል፡ ዘዘንመ፨ …Fol. 28rb: O Christ Nazarene, You who have received the suffering of the sun, lustrous and shining, when its brilliance darkened. [Write] in my heart the book of the spiritual story of Cyricus and the salutation of his image. While making ink out of Your divine blood that has rained by means of the Cross.
msItem.explicit: Fol. 32va, l.16: ... ሰላመ። መልክዑ፡ ለቂርቆስ[s.l.]፡ ወለኢየሉጣ፡ አባሉ፨ ናሁ፡ ጸሐፍኩ፡ እንዘ፡ አስተዋፅእ፡ እምነ፡ ገድሉ፡ ባርኪ፡ ሊተ፡ ማርያም፡ እግዝእተ፡ ኵሉ፨ ዘባረኪ፡ በዲበ፡ ምድር፡ ቡሩክ፡ ውእቱ፡ በላዕሉ፨ ወዘቀደስኪ፡ ለዓለም፡ ይሄሉ፨Fol. 32va, l.16: ... Here, I have written the Salutation of the image of Cyricus and Julitta, his relative, while extracting from his Vita. Pray for me, Mary, Lady of all. What You blessed on the earth is blessed above it, and what You sanctified it will be for the eternity.

listBibl.bibl: EMML no. 486 (late 19th or early 20th, Church of Qirqos, quarter of Boleʾ, ʾAddis ʾAbäba),

msItem.title: IV. Sälam - hymn for Cyricus
msItem.incipit: Fol. 32vb, l.5: ሰላም፡ ለከ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሕፃን። መዓድመ፡ መልክዕ፡ ወስን፨ ኢያፍርሃከ[sic]፡ ትግርምተ፡ ዕልዋን። …Fol. 32vb, l.5: Salutation to you, infant Cyricus, pleasing of image and beauty, whom the terror of the heretics does not terrified. ...
msItem.explicit: Fol. 33ra, l.3: ... እምሕዝብከ፡ ታሰስል፡ እንባዜ፨ ፨ ፨ ፨ ፨ ኦአምላከ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ መስተጋድል፡ በዝንቱ፡ ቃለ፡ ኪዳንከ፡ ወተአምሪከ፡ አድኅነኒ፡ ለገብርከ፡ ኃጥእ፡ ወአባሲ፡ ሀብተ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ሴ[sic]፡ ወለአመትከ፡ [vac] ወለጸሐፌ፡ ገድልከኒ፡ አነ፡ ቀሲስ፡ ኃይለ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ዘሰመዩኒ፡ ርእሰ፡ ደብር፡ ወሊቀ፡ ካህናት፨ ፨ ፨Fol. 33ra, l.3: ... you take away the faintheartedness from your people. O God of saint Cyricus, martyr, (spiritual) combatant, with this word of your covenant and your miracles save me, your sinful and transgressor servant, Habtä Śǝllase and your maid ... and also the scribe of your Vita, me, qäsis Ḫaylä ʾIyäsus, whom they appointed head of the monastery and archpriest.

EMML no. 4816 (1951/2, Church of Däse Mädḫane ˤAläm, Wällo),

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 35.0 folios, of which blank fols. 1r, 1v, 34r, 34v, 35r, 35v, in 4.0 quires .
27.0 22.7 3.3

list.item: 9 The original structure of the quires cannot be established due to the poor condition of the Ms. It can be assumed as follows: I(9/fols. 1r-9v)

supportDesc.condition: The original sewing is destroyed; most of the threads are broken and some of the leaves are held together by means of recent crude stitches. Several leaves have stains in inner margins (esp. fols. 7v–16r) and a few others are affected by humidity (esp. fols. 29r–33r). Fol. 20 is partly mutilated, a part of the text is missing.

layout.ab: The number varies between 18 and 22 lines.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

list.item: five red and black dot colon (used throughout the Ms.).
II. Four dot asterisk (esp. fols. 2ra, l.16, 32vb, l.5);
nine dot asterisk (used throughout the Ms.);
“X” with dashes above and below (esp. fols. 20vb, l.10, 32vb, l.8)
III. Nine dot asterisks, with chains of black and red dots above and below (esp. fols. 23va, 24va, 28ra, 32vb, 33ra).

handDesc.handNote:
Fine and careful. Black; red. Ḫaylä ʾIyäsusPriest (qäsis) Ḫaylä ʾIyäsus (mentioned in a supplication, fol. 33ra). He wrote also Ms. MMA-006.Late 19th century
ሰላ፡ for ሰላም፡ (esp. fol. 30ra, l.5)

list.item:
Fol. 33vab: Unidentified miracle of St. Cyricus (?), incomplete.
Written in a recent hand, in modern violet ink; poorly legible. In the blessing formula at the beginning, two individuals are mentioned: Habtä Śǝllase and Wälättä Yoḥannǝs. Both names are mentioned elsewhere (S. "Donor").
- The word Täʾamrihu is written in red on fol. 34v; a few other words, also in red, are written on the left side in the middle of the same folio.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.
The outer face of each board is decorated with a crudely carved cross.

origin.origDate: Late 19th century. The Ms. was produced by the same scribe as Ms. MMA-006 which is dated to 1886/87 A.D.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: Habtä Śǝllase is mentioned in the supplication. The same person is mentioned in the explicit of Text II (esp. fol. 28ra ls. 8-9) as the commissioner (the one who “caused [the book] to be written”). In most cases he appears associated with a female, “his maid”, whose name remains unknown: in some places it is not written and in some others it is washed out and replaced with a different name, Wälättä Yoḥannǝs (e.g., fols. 26ra, 26vb), in a recent hand.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
